intro: Cubeba auriculata, commonly known as the African eggplant, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades such as tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its fruit, which resembles a small egg, is typically green when unripe and turns red when mature. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
